page.title: 14Housing in Thame
page.content: Housing is relatively expensive in Thame as it is in most of the south- east of England. A new first floor maisonette with a lounge, kitchen, bathroom and two bedrooms would cost about 35,000 pounds. A semi-detached family home with 3 bed rooms, hall, dining room, lounge, bath- room and separate toilet and a small garden costs about 50,000 pounds. There are plenty of older houses in our area. For example, a terraced house built around the turn of the century with two bedrooms and an attractive garden is on sale near the centre of the town for 38,500 pounds. There are a few large older country houses in our area. These are usually very substantial houses, with 4-5 bedrooms and 2 reception rooms. These sell for about 150.000 pounds though some cost around 250,000 pounds.
